title: MLB fans stunned as Oakland Athletics star Mason Miller suffers bizarre injury while preparing to do an exercise
text:
MLB fans stunned as Oakland Athletics star Mason Miller suffers bizarre injury while preparing to do an exercise
MLB rookie pitcher Mason Miller suffered an injury unusually - and fans have been left shocked.
The
Oakland Athletics star reliever, 25, was placed on the 15-day injured list with a broken left pinky on Thursday.
The A's website revealed that Miller's non-throwing finger injury occurred on Monday.
As for the reason, the team shared that the flame-throwing 25-year-old put his hand down "awkwardly" on a trainer's table while he was preparing to do an exercise following Monday's win against the
Houston Astros.
During the game, Miller was electric, throwing just 11 pitches and retired all three batters.
His fastball averaged 101.4 miles per hour in the outing.
Read More on MLB
MLB fans were left without words by Miller's peculiar injury on X.
"Hate it for the guy," one commented.
"This is brutal. Get well soon Mason," a second wrote.
"Mason Miller did what?" a third asked.
Most read in Baseball
Miller has been sensational this season, posting a 2.21 ERA and striking out 70 batters in 40 2/3 innings.
He is 15 for 17 in save opportunities.
Miller's lack of saves is largely due to the fact Oakland has a disappointing 41-63 record.
He made the All-Star team in his rookie campaign and threw a pitcher with 103.6 mph in the game which broke a record.
The 25-year-old Miller has been a trade deadline candidate leading up to the July 30 deadline.
However, the A's have reportedly asked for a huge return.
Miller has five years before he hits free agency.
It doesn't seem likely that he will be traded but it won't be because of his pinky injury on his non-throwing hand.
Read More on The US Sun
Miller's injury won't be season-ending.
But throwing an injury into the mix makes it difficult for Oakland to receive the highest value for the rookie.
